intro: Elatostema oligophlebium, commonly known as the narrow-veined elatostema, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant features small, ovate leaves with a distinctive network of veins, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, dry fruits. Elatostema oligophlebium is typically found in lowland forests and is adapted to humid, nutrient-rich soils.
